Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Hector A. Chiesa, Pastor, Church Of God, 2135-37 Third Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10035.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by the Speaker Mark-Viverito.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Hector A. Chiesa, Pastor, Church of God, 2135-37 Third Avenue, New York, N.Y. 10035.

The Speaker (

Council Member Mark-Viverito) moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 12, 2014 be adopted as printed by Council Member Kallos.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Kallos moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of March 12, 2014 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices

Communication from the Office of Management & Budget - Transfer City funds between various agencies in Fiscal Year 2014 to implement changes to the City's expense budget, pursuant to Section 107(b) of the New York City Charter. (MN-2)
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Transfer City funds between various agencies in FY'14 to implement changes to the City's expense budget. (MN-2)

Items.MatterName: Appropriate new revenues of $1.964 billion in FY'14. (MN-3)

Items.Title: The Operating Budget of the Council of the City of New York.

Items.MatterName: The Operating Budget of the Council of the City of NY.

Items.MatterName: Schedule detailing the lump sum OTPS Unit of Appropriation of the Operating Budget of the Council of the City of NY.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Kallos:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application no. C 140157 ZSM, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, East 64th and East 68th Street, Manhattan (C 140157 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Kallos:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application no. C 140068 (A) MMM, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, East 64th and East 68th Street, Manhattan (C 140068 (A) MMM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Johnson:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure Application no. C 140167 ZSM, shall be subject to Council review.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 59-61 Thompson Street, Manhattan (C 140167 ZSM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 132 4th Avenue, in the Borough of Manhattan, Community District 3, Application no. 20145387 TCM, shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Sidewalk café, 132 4th Ave, Manhattan (20145387 TCM)

Items.Title: Communication from the Speaker
Discussion of General Orders
Reports of Special Committees
Reports of Standing Committees
Report of the Committee on Finance

A Local Law in relation to the date of submission by the Mayor of the proposed executive budget and budget message, the date of submission by the Borough Presidents of recommendations in response to the Mayor’s executive budget, the date of publication of a report by the director of the independent budget office analyzing the executive budget, the date by which the Council hearings pertaining to the executive budget shall conclude, the date by which if the expense budget has not been adopted, the expense budget and tax rate adopted as modified for the current fiscal year shall be deemed to have been extended for the new fiscal year until such time as a new expense budget has been adopted, the date by which if a capital budget and a capital program have not been adopted, the unutilized portion of all prior capital appropriations shall be deemed reappropriated, the date of submission by the Mayor of an estimate of the probable amount of receipts, the date by which any person or organization may submit an official alternative estimate of revenues, the date by which if the Council has not fixed the tax rates for the ensuing fiscal year, the commissioner of finance shall be authorized to complete the assessment rolls using estimated rates, and related matters, relating to the fiscal year two thousand fifteen.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Coupled on GO with the Message of Necessity
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Executive Budget Extender

A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring carbon monoxide detectors in certain assembly spaces.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Land Use

Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 140055 ZSM (L.U. No. 23), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712(a) of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York to modify the use regulations of Section 42-10 to allow Use Group 2 uses (residential uses) on the 2nd through 12th floors, and Section 42-14(D)(2)(b) to allow Use Group 6 uses (retail uses) below the level of the second story of a proposed mixed use development on a zoning lot that, as of December 15, 2003, is vacant, located at 688 Broadway (Block 531, Lot 4), in an M1-5B District, within the NoHo Historic District, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 23 - Zoning, Mixed use development, 688 Broadway, Manhattan (C 140055 ZSM)

Items.Title: Resolution approving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 140056 ZSM (L.U. No. 24), for the grant of a special permit pursuant to Section 74-712(b) of the Zoning Resolution of the City of New York to modify the height and setback requirements of Section 43-43 (Maximum Height of Front Wall and Required Front Setbacks) to facilitate the development of a 12-story mixed use development on a zoning lot where not more that 20 percent of the lot area is occupied by existing buildings as of December 15, 2003, located at 688 Broadway (Block 531, Lot 4), in an M1-5B District, within the NoHo Historic District, Borough of Manhattan.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 24 - Zoning, Mixed use development, 688 Broadway, Manhattan (C 140056 ZSM)

Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: LU 27 - Zoning, Rezone a portion of a R3-2 and R3-2/C2-2 to a C4-1 district, Queens Village, Queens (C 140037 ZMQ)

Items.MatterName: LU 35 - Landmarks, South Village Historic District, Manhattan (20145280 HKM (N 140213 HKM))

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution authorizing the Speaker to intervene, file an amicus brief, or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council of the City of New York in any appeals in the litigations captioned In re Bloomberg v. Liu and Neighborhood in the Nineties, Inc. v. City of New York for the purpose of defending provisions of the New York City Administrative Code that limit the size of single-adult shelters to two hundred beds.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Speaker to intervene, file an amicus brief, or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council of the City of New York in any appeals in the litigations captioned In re Bloomberg v. Liu and Neighborhood in the Nineties, Inc. v. City of NY fo

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass, and the President of the United States to sign S.2182, the Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act, legislation expanding and improving care provided to veterans and service members with mental health disorders or are at risk for suicide.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Suicide Prevention for American Veterans Act. (S.2182)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption from rent increases granted to certain senior citizens.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Increasing the maximum income level qualifying for exemption from rent increases granted to certain senior citizens.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to controlling emissions from businesses located in mixed-use buildings that use chemicals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Controlling emissions from businesses located in mixed-use buildings that use chemicals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the distance between parking signs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Distance between parking signs.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to penalties pursuant to the earned sick time act, for businesses recovering from damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Penalties pursuant to the earned sick time act, for businesses recovering from damage caused by Hurricane Sandy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring identification of contractors on construction projects where discretionary approval or financial assistance has been provided by the city.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring identification of contractors on construction projects where discretionary approval or financial assistance has been provided by the city.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to criminal and civil penalties for the performance of unlicensed electrical work.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Criminal and civil penalties for the performance of unlicensed electrical work.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to report noise complaints on a quarterly basis.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: NYPD to report noise complaints on a quarterly basis.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to elimination of permit and or filing fees for green building projects undertaken on one to four family homes.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Elimination of permit and or filing fees for green building projects undertaken on one to four family homes.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the City of New York to equally distribute funding for the operating budgets of New York City’s five District Attorney Offices over the next three fiscal years.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Equally distribute funding for the operating budgets of NYC’s 5 District Attorney Offices over the next 3 fiscal years.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the collection of demographic data regarding ancestry and languages spoken
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Collection of demographic data regarding ancestry and languages spoken.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the online publication of information relating to stop work orders issued by the department of buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Online publication of information relating to stop work orders issued by the department of buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a New York city identity card program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Creation of a New York city identity card program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to disclosing information related to refund anticipation loans in the top six languages spoken in the city.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Disclosing information related to refund anticipation loans in the top six languages spoken in the city.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.7964-B/S.5032-B, which would require wireless telephone companies that offer shared or family plans to allow victims of domestic violence to be released from the account without penalty in instances of domestic violence.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Women's Issues
Items.MatterName: Require wireless telephone companies that offer shared or family plans to allow victims of domestic violence to be released from the account without penalty in instances of domestic violence. (A.7964B/S.5032B)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Translation and publication of the New York city voters guide in additional languages.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Declaring the first Tuesday in May as World Asthma Day in NYC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a pilot program for reserving parking spaces in municipal parking facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Establishing a pilot program for reserving parking spaces in municipal parking facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York and the New York city building code, in relation to protecting street trees during construction activities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Protecting street trees during construction activities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Department of Homeless Services and the Human Resources Administration to track and report to the Council certain data regarding rental assistance programs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Requiring the Dept of Homeless Services and the Human Resources Administration to track and report to the Council certain data regarding rental assistance programs.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming two thoroughfares and public places in the Borough of the Bronx, East 177th Street, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Renaming two thoroughfares and public places, Bronx, East 177th Street.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, the administrative code of the city of New York, the New York city building code, and the New York city mechanical code, in relation to the New York city air pollution control code.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Air pollution control code.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the New York city taxi and limousine commission’s critical drivers and persistent violators programs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: NYC taxi and limousine commission’s critical drivers and persistent violators programs.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to establish a comprehensive college preparation program, based on the college readiness model proposed by the Urban Youth Collaborative, to improve and expand college access for all students.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Establish a comprehensive college preparation program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied by a photograph of the alleged violation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Requiring that notices of violation issued by the department of sanitation be accompanied by a photograph of the alleged violation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bulk milk truck weight restrictions.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Bulk milk truck weight restrictions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring photographic documentation of alleged violations identified during sanitary inspections of food service establishments.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Requiring photographic documentation of alleged violations identified during sanitary inspections of food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a pilot program involving black box or telematics technology in taxis and street hail liveries.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Pilot program involving black box or telematics technology in taxis and street hail liveries.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the reporting of crash data involving taxi and limousine commission licensed vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Reporting of crash data involving taxi and limousine commission licensed vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring photographs to be included with certain notices of violation for parking violations.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring photographs to be included with certain notices of violation for parking violations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a one year delay for businesses affected by Hurricane Sandy to comply with the Earned Sick Time Act.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: One year delay for businesses affected by Hurricane Sandy to comply with the Earned Sick Time Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of buildings to maintain a registry of restrictive covenants.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of buildings to maintain a registry of restrictive covenants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign S.6717 and A.8653, in relation to authorizing the creation of small business tax-deferred savings accounts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the creation of small business tax-deferred savings accounts. (S.6717/A.8653)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign S.6865 and A.9135, legislation which would promote opportunities for service-disabled veteran owned small businesses in State contracting.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Veterans
Items.MatterName: Promote opportunities for service-disabled veteran owned small businesses in State contracting. (S.6865/A.9135)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to expanding the membership of the board of standards and appeals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Expanding the membership of the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring the advice and consent of the city council for commissioners of the board of standards and appeals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Requiring the advice and consent of the city council for commissioners of the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to community involvement in decisions of the board of standards and appeals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Community involvement in decisions of the board of standards and appeals.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Housing Authority to stop charging tenants a debit card convenience fee when a rent payment is made using a debit card.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Housing
Items.MatterName: NYCHA to stop charging tenants a debit card convenience fee when a rent payment is made using a debit card.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) to establish a Metrocard discount fare program through which eligible non-profit organizations can receive and distribute discounted Metrocards to their clients.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: MTA to establish a Metrocard discount fare program through which eligible non-profit organizations can receive and distribute discounted Metrocards to their clients.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly urging the Metropolitan Transportation Authority to provide greater advance notification for planned service disruptions.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Strongly urging the MTA to provide greater advance notification for planned service disruptions.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to increase the civil penalties to $2,500 for a first offense and $15,000 for each subsequent offense within a two year period for failure to comply with the utility notification requirements of Article 36 of the General Business Law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Increase the civil penalties to $2,500 for a first offense and $15,000 for each subsequent offense within a two year period for failure to comply with the utility notification requirements of Article 36 of the General Business Law.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation that would enable the spouse of someone enrolled in the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption Program (SCRIE) to continue receiving SCRIE benefits when the enrolled spouse dies, and the widow or widower is within 5 years of the age requirement for receipt of SCRIE
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging
Items.MatterName: Enable the spouse of someone enrolled in the Senior Citizen Rent Increase Exemption Program (SCRIE) to continue receiving SCRIE benefits when the enrolled spouse dies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of voluntary registry for persons with special medical needs.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Creation of voluntary registry for persons with special medical needs.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to require parental consent prior to releasing personally identifiable student data.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring DOE to require parental consent prior to releasing personally identifiable student data.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the silver alert program to include missing persons with developmental disabilities.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Amending the silver alert program to include missing persons with developmental disabilities.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Office for People with Developmental Disabilities to include the use of GPS tracking devices as a covered service available under the People First Waiver.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: NYS Office for People with Developmental Disabilities to include the use of GPS tracking devices as a covered service available under the People First Waiver.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and the general municipal law, in relation to establishing in the counties of Nassau and  Suffolk  a  demonstration  program  implementing  speed violation  monitoring  systems in school speed zones by means of photo devices, and in relation to photo speed violation  monitoring  systems in  school  speed zones in the city of New York; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof A.9206 / S.6918
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Establishing in the counties of Nassau and Suffolk a demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Communication from the Mayor  -  AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and the general municipal law, in relation to establishing in the counties of Nassau and  Suffolk  a  demonstration  program  implementing  speed violation  monitoring  systems in school speed zones by means of photo devices, and in relation to photo speed violation  monitoring  systems in  school  speed zones in the city of New York; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof A.9206 / S.6918
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Mayor's Message be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Resolution authorizing the Speaker to intervene, file an amicus brief, or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council of the City of New York in any appeals in the litigations captioned In re Bloomberg v. Liu and Neighborhood in the Nineties, Inc. v. City of New York for the purpose of defending provisions of the New York City Administrative Code that limit the size of single-adult shelters to two hundred beds.
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Adopted by the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.


Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the Speaker to intervene, file an amicus brief, or join an amicus brief on behalf of the Council of the City of New York in any appeals in the litigations captioned In re Bloomberg v. Liu and Neighborhood in the Nineties, Inc. v. City of NY fo

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
There were 47 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
